newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Britain to protest shooting by Turkish forces.
newsitem.headline: Britain to protest shooting by Turkish forces.

text.p: Shots were fired at two British soldiers who apparently strayed into Turkish-held northern Cyprus on Tuesday and a spokesman for the British troops on the island said Britain would protest.
Mervyn Wynne-Jones said the two soldiers came under fire from positions held by Turkish forces on Tuesday morning as they were checking pillars marking the boundary of the base.
"It appears they may have strayed into the Turkish controlled area," he said.
One bullet hit the vehicle the soldiers were driving but no-one was hurt, said the spokesman at the bases that Britain has retained since the sialnd gained independence in 1960.
"British representations will be made in due course," Wynne-Jones told Reuters.

The two soldiers, members of the Royal Engineers, were on patrol on a link road within the eastern sovereign base area in southeastern Cyprus. The northern part of the road is manned by Turkish troops.
Some 30,000 Turkish troops are stationed in northern Cyprus, occupied by Turkey in 1974 following a short-lived coup in Nicosia backed by the military then ruling Greece.
